summary: Mild dehydration is associated with decreased alertness and increased fatigue perception. Proactive hydration earlier in the day is often associated with more stable afternoon energy.
observed_patterns: Delayed hydration → reactive rather than preventive
Busy or call-heavy days → lower intake
implication_logic: If hydration is low or started after energy dropped, perceived fatigue may increase. On busy days, earlier sips often reduce afternoon drag.
intervention_leverage: Move hydration earlier. Timing may matter more than quantity.
